image.altText: A woman seen in profile, next to a reflective wall.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price is asking supporters to dig deep ahead of the festive season and help bankroll a $125,000 campaign fund three years out from the 2028 federal election.

title.children: Nampijinpa Price asks for $125k in donations to meet 'urgent end of 2025 goal'

image.altText: Ebony Thompson

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has confirmed a rural Darwin childcare centre and three of its supervisors have been charged after the death of a toddler at the centre in 2023.

title.children: Childcare centre and workers charged after toddler's death outside Darwin

image.altText: A chopper shot from below, it is parked on green grass and a blue sky can be seen in the background.

props.synopsis: Australia's aviation watchdog has issued a warning to the sector, after accounts of widespread chopper rule-breaking were aired during the trial of Northern Territory croc wrangler Matt Wright.

title.children: Aviation authority warns of 'zero tolerance' in wake of Matt Wright trial

image.altText: a blonde woman wearing a black dress

props.synopsis: A Darwin real estate agent accused of running over the foot of a BMW car repossession agent has been refused bail in the Darwin Local Court.

title.children: Real estate agent allegedly drove over foot of worker repossessing BMW, court hears

image.altText: Black and white sign on top of roof with URBAN RAMPAGE on.

props.synopsis: Outback retailer Urban Rampage withdraws its appeal on a Centrepay credit ban issued by Australia's financial regulator.

title.children: Outback retailer withdraws bid to overturn Centrepay credit ban

image.altText: The Sydney Opera House lit up with poppies as a bugler plays on Remembrance Day, 2025.

props.synopsis: People across Australia have gathered to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

title.children: Australians mark 107th Remembrance Day with services honouring the fallen

image.altText: the outside of a house with building fencing around it

props.synopsis: Eleven flood buyback homes sell without a reserve price in the NSW Northern Rivers, with more to hit the market before the end of the year.

title.children: 'Surreal' experience as flood-affected homes sold for as little as $1

image.altText: A menulog closed sign is seen in the window of a restaurant

props.synopsis: Food delivery company Menulog says it will cease operating in Australia in two weeks' time, prompting questions about whether Australia can maintain a competitive food delivery market.

title.children: Menulog to cease Australian operations

image.altText: A man with a grey beard and black cap and a blonde woman resting her hand on his shoulder smile in a radio studio.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Office of Public Prosecutions says it will not lay contempt of court charges against the controversial radio hosts, who made comments about the Erin Patterson case in the middle of her trial.

title.children: 'Lock that b**** up': Kyle and Jackie O avoid charges over mushroom trial comments

image.altText: An aurora event on Bruny Island in 2024.

props.synopsis: One of nature's most magnificent shows, the southern lights, could be on display for large parts of southern Australia tonight with a severe solar storm event impacting on Earth. But the boom in aurora activity will not last forever.

title.children: Chance of aurora sighting tonight as G4 storm forecast

image.altText: Photo illustration shows a downward trending line chart with emissions from a fossil fuel plant and a forest on either side.

props.synopsis: The Coalition is debating whether to dump its commitment to the net zero climate target. Here's what that term actually means.

title.children: Can we tackle global warming without net zero? Here's what it really means

image.altText: Houses are seen in the suburb of Kelvin Grove in Brisbane

props.synopsis: A new report finds that prospective Australian homebuyers are increasingly abandoning their dreams of a freestanding house in favour of more budget-friendly townhouses and units.

title.children: Australian homebuyers lower expectations in hot housing market

image.altText: Two men in suits formally pose for the camera

props.synopsis: Japan's ambassador to Australia calls for the two countries to form an "equilateral" security triangle with the United States, while championing the role of gas in the clean energy transition.

title.children: Japanese ambassador calls for security 'triangle' with Australia, US

image.altText: England Test cricket captain Ben Stokes speaks to the media at training.

props.synopsis: Critics of England's truncated preparation for this summer's Ashes Test series are off the mark, according to touring captain Ben Stokes.

title.children: Stokes takes aim at 'has-beens' as England's Ashes prep criticised

image.altText: 2025-10-21T111320Z_2026951675_RC2ZCY92P5PC_RTRMADP_3_BRITAIN-ROYALS-ANDREW-SCANDAL

props.synopsis: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor has applied to close down some of his last remaining business interests, weeks after he was stripped of his titles and honours.

title.children: Former prince Andrew shuts down royal business venture

image.altText: polaroid image of three women, one looking a little withdrawn

props.synopsis: Unlike extroverts or introverts, otroverts don't look outward or retreat inward to be energised.

title.children: Not introverted or extroverted? You could be an otrovert

image.altText: A blonde jockey smiles as she holds a gleaming trophy aloft at a race track.

props.synopsis: History-making jockey Jamie Melham has hit the headlines for the wrong reasons, with the Melbourne Cup winner banned for 30 race meetings for careless riding that resulted in a race fall for Blake Shinn.

title.children: Melbourne Cup winner Jamie Melham banned over Blake Shinn race fall

image.altText: Bagpipers

props.synopsis: The biggest ever ensemble of bagpipers gathered in Melbourne's Fed Square to play tribute to AC/DC, smashing a world record.

title.children: Bagpipe world record broken in Melbourne

image.altText: Eddie Murphy laughs while sitting on a chair in home, apparently being interviewed.

props.synopsis: Eddie Murphy has taken on many characters throughout his career, sometimes even within the same film. But a new documentary explores the "real Eddie Murphy" — someone the actor and comedian says few people actually know.

title.children: Eddie Murphy conquered Hollywood without ever revealing his true self

image.altText: middle aged man in suit smiling at camera on centre

props.synopsis: Macedon Ranges Mayor Dominic Bonanno says he has been caught speeding and drink driving in his mayoral vehicle.

title.children: Victorian mayor caught drink driving and speeding in mayoral vehicle

image.altText: Man in hat smiling in front of plane

props.synopsis: A preliminary report is released into the fatal crash that killed pilot Paul Smith on the NSW south coast, in which the light plane entered a steep descent less than 90 seconds after eight skydivers jumped out.

title.children: Investigators examine if pilot tried to exit plane before fatal crash

image.altText: Capital Wind Farm

props.synopsis: Rainforest Reserves Australia has faced a Senate inquiry amid allegations of using AI and referencing non-existent projects and groups in submissions against an axed wind farm.

title.children: Conservation group admits AI use and 'errors' in anti-wind farm campaign

image.altText: A flock of birds fly above a red river.

props.synopsis: A lawyer for billionaire Andrew Forrest questions an anthropologist's credibility over his opposition to plans to change a sacred Pilbara waterway.

title.children: Anthropologist under fire over sacred river serpent in 'Twiggy' Forrest case

image.altText: Mike Burgess wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: ASIO director-general Mike Burgess urges businesses to protect their data to prepare for possible attacks from hostile states.

title.children: Spy chief warns of China espionage threat to business, critical infrastructure

image.altText: A man with facial tattoos holding a microphone and performing

props.synopsis: Queensland Health says the three infected people were at last month's concert of American singer Jelly Roll at the Brisbane Entertainment Centre and is warning others who attended to be alert for symptoms.

title.children: Alert issued after three people with measles attend Jelly Roll concert

image.altText: A kid in a fedora stands next to police officers.

props.synopsis: Louvre heist "fedora man" Pedro Elias Garzon Delvaux says the inspiration behind his vintage look includes Agatha Christie's famed detective Hercule Poirot and James Bond.

title.children: Louvre heist 'detective' Pedro reveals inspirations behind viral look

image.altText: John Setka sitting behind a number of microphones at a Melbourne media conference.

props.synopsis: Police allege the 61-year-old sent threatening emails to the administrator of the construction union.

title.children: Former CFMEU boss John Setka charged with threatening union administrator

image.altText: Proposed site of Russian Embassy in Canberra

props.synopsis: The lease was granted to Russia in 2008, but was withdrawn when parliament passed a new law citing ASIO advice that the planned embassy could pose a threat to national security.

title.children: Russia loses High Court battle with Commonwealth over embassy site

image.altText: Liberal Party leader Sussan Ley speaks to an audience dominated by older people.

props.synopsis: The Coalition risks political extinction unless it can reconnect with younger voters who have abandoned it in droves.

title.children: Demographic tide threatens to sweep Coalition away

image.altText: Medical staff at St Vincent Hospital

props.synopsis: Doctors and medical associations have backed a Melbourne hospital's emergency department triage policy to improve care for First Nations patients, describing criticisms of the closing the gap measure as 'opportunistic, uninformed'.

title.children: This hospital's ED policy helped close the gap. Then came the criticism

image.altText: An old image of a bridge and people playing by it.

props.synopsis: A single-lane historic wooden bridge on the New South Wales far south coast is set to be replaced with a concrete structure, prompting backlash from community members.

title.children: Council votes to scrap timber from redesign of loved 130yo bridge

image.altText: Sydney FC player Cortnee Vine curled up on the ground after an injury in an A-League Women game.

props.synopsis: More than two-thirds of A-League Women players were in psychological distress last season, including experiencing disordered eating, alcohol misuse or disturbed sleep, according to football's players' union.

title.children: 'Distressing' impact of A-League Women season on players revealed by PFA

image.altText: A crowded room with security guards dressed in blue clashing with protesters with flags and placards.

props.synopsis: The incident caused "minor injuries to two security staff, and minor damage to the venue," according to a spokesperson for the United Nations.

title.children: Protesters clash with security at COP30 climate summit in Brazil

image.altText: a bowl of blueberries

props.synopsis: Australians' surging appetite for berries has prompted the national farm chemical watchdog to suspend a popular insecticide.

title.children: Regulator suspends use of dimethoate insecticide on berries
